business.headline: Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

Surprise rally lights up Dalal Street, Sensex jumps 1,500 points. Here's whyShare market today: Despite a slight uptick in volatility, sentiment turned decisively positive as fears around global trade tensions began to fade. Broader market indices joined the rally, reflecting widespread optimism among investors.

End of the road for BluSmart as Sebi exposes Gensol fraudMany users across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai reported that they could no longer book rides through the BluSmart app. The company also sent a notification to users stating that bookings were being temporarily closed.

Infosys Q4 results today: All eyes on FY26 outlook, dividend detailsInfosys Q4FY25 results: As the second-largest software services exporter gears up to release its earnings, investors will be watching closely for guidance on FY26 revenue growth, margins, and management's take on business sentiment in key markets.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Explained: Why Nvidia's market value dropped $148 billion overnightNvidia shares were hit hard in the overnight trading session on Wall Street, falling nearly 7% and losing $148 billion in market value.

Wipro shares tank 6% in early trade despite strong Q4 earnings. Buy or sell?Wipro share price: At 9:20 am, Wipro shares were trading 5.33% lower at Rs 234.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. The decline came after the company reported its earnings post-market hours on Wednesday.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Rio Tinto partners with Indian firm to explore low-carbon aluminium projectThe potential development could see up to 1 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of primary aluminium smelting and 2 mtpa of alumina production, both energized by renewable wind and solar power, supported by pumped hydro storage, the global miner said.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open lower. Here's whyDespite the weak outlook for Thursday's session, Sensex and Nifty have seen a strong upward trend in the last few days. In the past three sessions, Nifty50 has gone up by 4.6% while Sensex has gained 4.3%.

Stocks to watch on April 17: Wipro, Gensol, Tata Steel, BEL, Paytm, Hero MotoCorpSeveral companies will announce their results for Q4 FY25 on Thursday. These include Infosys, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Jio Financial Services, HDFC Asset Management Company, Tata Elxsi, National Standard (India), and E2E Networks.

21 acres for just 99 paise: Big land allotment to TCS as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

Who are Gensol's promoters Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi?According to Sebi's findings, both Anmol and Puneet are accused of misusing company funds. The market regulator claims that the promoters treated the company like their personal business.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares jumped 6% todayShares of IndusInd Bank were trading 5.51% higher at Rs 776.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) around 12:34 pm.

Over 3 million iPhones sold: Apple likely to post best-ever quarter in IndiaThe Q1 2025 number is a big jump from the 2.21 million iPhones sold in the same period last year. It shows how fast Apple is growing in India, a market that is becoming more important for the company every year.

Investment advisor warns against inflation: 'By 2030, you'll own less, pay more'Abhijit Chokshi stated in his post that most people think inflation means things getting expensive. But he explains that inflation has two faces. One is visible inflation and the other is invisible inflation.

PwC shuts down operations in more than a dozen countries: ReportThe decision was taken due to mounting differences with local partners. Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
IREDA share price jumps 6% after strong Q4 results. All you need to knowIREDA shares jumped sharply after strong Q4 earnings, though asset quality concerns could temper gains in the near term.

Gensol Engineering share price crashes to all-time low. Should you buy or avoid?The stock has now crashed 84% since the start of 2025 and is down nearly 87% over the past year, making it one of the worst-performing listed firms in the clean energy space.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

entertainment.headline: The Stolen Girl review: A taut, emotionally charged thriller that stirs and surprisesReleased-Wed Apr 16, 2025'The Stolen Girl' is a gripping series that delves into the emotional turmoil of a mother's worst nightmare. With compelling performances and a focus on the complexities of motherhood, this thriller keeps viewers guessing. Read our review.

Anurag Kashyap rejects rumours of quitting films: I'm busier than Shah Rukh KhanFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap shut down rumours of him quitting cinema. In a post on X, he listed his line-up and stated that he's busier than Shah Rukh Khan.

Lorrie Morgan cancels shows to support husband battling mouth cancerLorrie Morgan cancels upcoming performances to care for her husband, Randy White, who is undergoing mouth cancer treatment. Morgan, grateful for support, focuses on family and privacy during this challenging time.

Love Island USA Spinoff: Full cast revealed for 'Beyond the Villa'Peacock's new spinoff Love Island: Beyond the Villa premieres this summer, reuniting fan-favorite Islanders as they navigate fame, relationships, and personal growth outside the villa.

MobLand Episode 4: When and where to stream 'Rat Trap' on Paramount+MobLand Episode 4, "Rat Trap," drops on April 20, 2025. It will stream at midnight PT and 3 a.m. ET. The episode continues the tense crime drama with high-stakes twists.

Dolly Parton to release new memoir 'Star of the Show' this NovemberDolly Parton, 79, announces her new book Star of the Show: My Life on Stage, chronicling her decades-long music career with personal stories, rare photos, and a narrated audiobook.

Meet Shalla-Bal: Julia Garner's Silver Surfer shines in 2025's fantastic fourJulia Garner stars as Shalla-Bal, a female Silver Surfer, in The Fantastic Four: First Steps. The 2025 reboot introduces Marvel's First Family to the MCU, with connections to future Avengers films.

The Marías announce 2025 North American tour, kicking off at CoachellaThe Marías have announced their 2025 Submarine Tour, starting at Coachella. With festival stops, new music, and support from julie and Momma, the tour promises an unforgettable indie-pop experience.

Lily Collins to begin filming Emily in Paris Season 5 in Rome in MayProduction for 'Emily in Paris' Season 5 will kick off in Rome this May, before heading back to Paris. Lily Collins' Emily will explore new romantic dynamics with returning and new cast members.

Thunderbolts IMAX tickets sell out in under an hour across US citiesMarvel fans eagerly snapped up free IMAX tickets for 'Thunderbolts' in under an hour in some major US cities. The film, featuring a team of antiheroes, premieres in India on May 1, 2025.

Gossip Girl star Michelle Trachtenberg's death linked to diabetes complicationsMichelle Trachtenberg, known for her roles in 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' and 'Gossip Girl', has passed away. The NYC medical examiner confirmed the cause as complications from diabetes.

Fantastic Four trailer: Marvel's 1st family sets out to defend Earth from GalactusThe first trailer for 'Fantastic Four: The First Steps' introduces Marvel's First Family with a new twist. The film will arrive in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Tamannaah Bhatia to play Bipasha Basu-like role in No Entry 2: ReportActor Tamannaah Bhatia might have been approached to play one of the leads in Boney Kapoor's 'No Entry 2'. The film already features Varun Dhawan, Arjun Kapoor and Diljit Dosanjh as leads.

Asim Riaz out of Battleground after fight with Abhishek Malhan, Rubina Dilaik?Asim Riaz has reportedly been removed from the reality show Battleground following a heated altercation with co-judges Abhishek Malhan and Rubina Dilaik. The incident escalated after an initial disagreement during the shoot, leading to the cancellation of filming for the day.

L2 Empuraan OTT release: When and where to watch Mohanlal, Prithviraj filmThe highly successful Malayalam film 'L2: Empuraan', directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran and starring Mohanlal, will soon be available for streaming. The film, which faced controversy over its depiction of communal riots, will be on JioHotstar from April 24.

Kesari 2 advance booking Day 1: Akshay Kumar's film off to decent start at box officeAkshay Kumar's latest release, 'Kesari 2', seems to be starting on a decent note, and if it receives good word-of-mouth, the film has great potential to finally bring Kumar back into the big leagues at the box office.

Daredevil Born Again: Does the revival deliver, and is season two worth the wait?The revival of 'Daredevil: Born Again' brought a fresh storyline and new cast, sparking excitement among fans. As Matt Murdock's dual life unfolds, the series balanced action with deep character development.

Grimes slams beauty standards after Sephora ad interrupts podcastGrimes slams Sephora ad interruption on Apple Podcasts, calling it a "demonic AI wraith" invading her peaceful moment. The singer voiced concerns about beauty standards, AI, and their impact on young women, especially her daughter.
Rapper Badshah's rare photo with daughter Jessemy, seen yet?Rapper Badshah posted a rare picture with his daughter, Jessemy, on Instagram. Fans praised the father-daughter duo.

general news.headline: Trump calls Harvard a 'disgrace' amid backlash over federal funding cutDonald Trump's latest comments come amid nationwide protests sparked by the White House's decision to freeze approximately USD 2.3 billion in federal funding and reports that the Internal Revenue Service is preparing to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

Two killed, 6 injured in shooting at Florida State University, campus on lockdownA gunman opened fire near the student union at Florida State University on Thursday, killing two and injuring at least six others, prompting a campus lockdown, chaotic evacuation scenes.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

With compelling performances and a focus on the complexities of motherhood, this thriller keeps viewers guessing. Read our review.

Trump optimistic about 'great deal' with China after slapping 245% tariffsDespite sharp exchanges between the US and Chinese leaders recently over the tariff issue, Donald Trump expressed confidence that the two nations would "make a very good deal". He also expressed optimism about trade discussions with the European Union.

IPL 2025, MI vs SRH: All-round Mumbai hammer Hyderabad as Wankhede springs surpriseMumbai Indians (MI) registered their third win of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), beating Sunrisers Hyderabad by four wickets in Match 33 at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Will Jacks emerged as the star for MI with his all-round show.

Dirty, eating fish: Non-veg row sparks Marathi vs Gujarati clash in MumbaiIn the video that has surfaced from the altercation, an MNS leader is heard saying, 'He thinks Marathis are dirty. That means Maharashtra is also dirty. So, why did he come to a dirty place?'

Electric acne patches look cool and are viral. But do they even work?Electric acne patches with light therapy are wearable patches that use LED light (mostly blue, red, or both) to 'kill acne-causing bacteria, reduce inflammation, and speed up healing'. Indian influencers are obsessed with them.

Cancerous growth of violence: Governor jabs Mamata Banerjee over Bengal unrestWest Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose blamed Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for the state's political violence and alleged law-and-order failures, while urging collective action against communal unrest.

I like her very much: Trump gushes over Italian PM Giorgia MeloniGiorgia Meloni's visit to Washington today had been highly anticipated, especially amid ongoing trade tensions between the United States and the European Union.

Former Bengal BJP chief Dilip Ghosh to marry party colleague today: SourcesSources said several Trinamool leaders, including Kunal Ghosh and Debangshu Bhattacharya, have also extended their wishes on the occasion.

Anurag Kashyap rejects rumours of quitting films: I'm busier than Shah Rukh KhanFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap shut down rumours of him quitting cinema. In a post on X, he listed his line-up and stated that he's busier than Shah Rukh Khan.

JEE Mains Result 2025 Live: JEE Main Session 2 - What's the latest update on results?JEE Mains Result 2025 is expected to be declared soon on the official website, but the exact timing remains uncertain. The NTA has removed the final answer key from the official website without providing any explanation.

Who is Phoenix Ikner? Florida State University gunman, son of a Deputy SheriffTwo people were killed and at least five others have been hospitalised after Ikner opened fire at Florida State University. He has been taken into custody.

Doubting her character, UP woman kills teen daughter, buries body in backyardA UP court sentenced a woman to life imprisonment for murdering her 14-year-old daughter over character doubts. The girl's body was found buried in their backyard after she went missing.

Mamata fire vs VHP-BJP ire: How rhetoric inflames Bengal scarred by Waqf violenceCommunal accusations and reckless political vocabulary threaten to push the state towards a dangerous new normal in the aftermath of the violence

Is Mehul Choksi an Indian citizen? Bombay High Court asks ED to clarifyThe Bombay High Court sought clarification on fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi's citizenship status while hearing his plea to cancel a non-bailable warrant issued in the PNB scam case.

Unable to conceive, woman fakes pregnancy, kidnaps newborn from Delhi hospitalThe accused, Pooja, escaped with the infant at around 3:17 pm, evading everyone's notice, according to the police. Her motive? She wanted to become a mother after having no luck conceiving during seven years of marriage.

Gangster behind 14 attacks in Punjab and wanted by NIA detained in US: SourcesPassia had claimed responsibility for an attack in which a senior police officer's vehicle exploded near the Gumtala police post in Punjab's Amritsar in January 2025.
After sudden baldness, people in this Maharashtra district now seeing nail lossIn Maharashtra's Buldhana, people who had been suffering from hair loss are now reportedly facing nail deformities.

Knife-wielding US citizen tries to hijack flight in Belize, shot dead mid-airThe assailant wanted to be taken out of the country and demanded more fuel for the plane, reported ABC News. He was shot by a passenger on board, police said.

It's a shame, horrible thing: Trump reacts to Florida University shootingA shooting at Florida State University left two dead and five injured, many of them in critical condition. The campus went into lockdown as police searched for the shooter. President Trump called it "a horrible thing."

India, Bangladesh among 7 nations listed 'safe' by EU to fast-track asylum casesThe EU has named seven nations, including India and Egypt, as "safe" for returning asylum seekers, aiming to fast-track claims within three months. The list may change over time based on conditions in each country, according to EU officials.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: Rohit Sharma redemption is not far away. Here's whyRohit Sharma showed flashes of his true self during his entertaining knock against SRH on Thursday, April 17. The MI legend may have a big score coming up as soon as the openers seem to have found the right rhythm.

Rohit Sharma a permanent impact player? Fans unhappy with MI team combinationIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: A section of Mumbai Indians fans have expressed their disappointment with the five-time champions using their star player, Rohit Sharma, as an Impact Sub. More often than not, the former captain has played as Impact Sub.

Rizwan has been under heavy criticism after the Pakistan's poor Champions Trophy campaign.

Teenage shooter Suruchi Singh leads India's medal rush in Peru World Cup ISSF World Cup 2025: A day after winning the 10m air pistol gold medal, Suruchi Singh, an 18-year-old from Haryana, combined with Saurabh Chaudhary to win the 10m air pistol mixed team in Lima.

Sacking of India assistant coach shocks fansThe sacking of Abhishek Nayar, India's assistant coach, just eight months into his tenure has not gone down well with a section of fans. South Korean boy band Treasure ignited the crowd at Centerfield Plaza.

Watch: MS Dhoni stops to take selfie with fan in wheelchair amid airport securityIPL2025: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni took time out to meet and greet a fan in a wheelchair while heading out of an airport. Dhoni's heartwarming gesture has been appreciated on social media.

MI vs SRH, Match preview: Mount 300 in-sight as heavy-hitting sides faceoffIPL 2025, MI vs SRH Match Preview: With both teams packed with explosive hitters and eyeing momentum, MI vs SRH at Wankhede could turn into a run-fest. If the stars align, IPL 2025 might just witness its first 300-run innings on April 17.

Jess Jonassen left out, Flintoff earns maiden Cricket Australia women's contractCricket Australia (CA) has unveiled its new 18-player women's national contract list for the 2025-26 season. Veteran all-rounder Jess Jonassen has been left out of the updated list.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
